activities.title: Building Question Sentences: Detailed Rules (Part 1)
activities.body:
1) **Identify the Info**: Pata karo aapko detail chahiye (WH) ya sirf yes/no?

2) **Pick Your â€˜Helper Wordâ€™** (auxiliary): do/does/did, is/are/am, can/could, will/would, etc.

3) **Decide the Word Order**:
   - For yes/no: [Aux] + [Subject] + [Verb] + (Object/extra)?
     e.g., â€˜Do you speak English?â€™
   - For WH: [WH word] + [Aux] + [Subject] + [Verb]?
     e.g., â€˜Where do you live?â€™

4) **Politeness** (if needed): add â€œCould you...?â€, â€œWould you mind...?â€ or â€œMay I...?â€

activities.text: Badi simple baat: English question = â€œInversionâ€ (aux before subject) + optional WH word. Bas yahi rule yaad rakho!

activities.title: Building Question Sentences: Detailed Rules (Part 2)
activities.body:
5) **Extra Words**: If a question needs a direct object or adverb, place it after the verb. E.g., â€œWhat do you like to eat for breakfast?â€

6) **Subject vs. Object Questions**: â€˜Who ate the cake?â€™ (no auxiliary needed if â€œwhoâ€ is the subject). But â€˜Who did you meet?â€™ (aux needed if â€œwhoâ€ is object). Trickier but helps advanced.

7) **Tag Questions**: Add â€˜..., isnâ€™t it?â€™ or â€˜..., do you?â€™ at the end for confirmation.

8) **Practice**: The more you try building questions from these rules, the more natural it becomes!

activities.title: Comprehensive List: Real-Life Questions (Part 1)
activities.body:

activities.title: Comprehensive List: Real-Life Questions (Part 2)

**D) Travel / Directions**

activities.title: Comprehensive List: Real-Life Questions (Part 4) - The Finale!
activities.body:
**J) Phone Calls**
1) May I speak to [Name]?
2) Could you repeat the number/email?
3) Do you have a moment to talk?
4) Is this a good time, or should I call back?

**These** will keep you prepared for nearly **any** everyday conversation scenario!
